critique: The document outlines regulations for issuing Non-Necessity Certificates for emergency facilities deemed no longer necessary for national defense during the emergency period. It focuses on defining terms, determining non-necessity, and outlining procedures for application and certification. There is no apparent ideological tilt, immigration stance, or emphasis on social inclusion/exclusion. The document seems to expand executive power by delegating authority to the Chairman of the War Production Board. It also centralizes power at the federal level through the War Production Board. The document prioritizes national security. It involves government intervention in the economy by regulating emergency facilities.
